Con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en ropa de verano, ya que no tiene en inventario y que se vende mucho. Comprara: short, camiseta, sandalias, perfume, pantalón de varón y de dama, a si como productos de la zermat el cual vende por catálogos.
texts.en:
Six years ago, Keyla began selling cosmetics, shoes and clothing, in order to help herself economically, since her husband works in an enterprise zone and his salary is low. 

With Afodenic she found an investment opportunity, thanks to a loan which she used to buy a variety of merchandise. This helped her increase her sales and attract more customers. Today she is living in her own house, although it needs many repairs and she hopes to improve it in the future. 

With this new loan, she will invest in summer clothing, since she does not have it in her inventory and it sells well. She will buy: shorts, t-shirts, sandals, perfume, and men's and women's pants, as well as Zermat products, which she sells out of catalogs.

loans.use: to buy a variety of men's and women's clothing so she can increase her sales and her household income.

loans.name: Amancio

texts.es:
Amancio tiene 42 años, está casado con la Sra. Floriana Fernández, no tienen hijos, ambos viven en un asentamiento en la ciudad de Paraguarí.
Amancio es taxista, empieza sus actividades diarias a muy tempranas horas de la mañana y regresa muy tarde a su casa, ya por la noche, pues posee mucho trabajo gracias a su buen servicio, pero sabe que a pesar de que no puede compartir mucho con su familia, él es la fuente de ingresos de su familia y debe luchar cada día por el sustento económico, y más aún para poder tener hijos bajo el amparo material necesario.
El tiene su parada a una cuadra de la oficina de Fundación Paraguaya, fue así que contactó con la institución para poder solicitar el crédito a Kiva.
Desea el crédito para la reparación de su vehículo, pues es el único medio de trabajo que posee.
texts.en:
Amancio is 42 years old and is married to Floriana Fernández. They do not have children, and they live together in a neighborhood of the city of Paraguarí.

Amancio is a taxi driver. He starts his daily work at a very early hour in the morning and returns home very late, when it is already night, since he has a lot of work thanks to his excellent service. He knows that although he cannot spend much time with his family, he is their source of income, and he needs to struggle each day for economic sustenance, and even more so that he can have children and provide for their material needs. 

He has his taxi stand one block from the office of the Paraguaya Foundation, and that is how he came to contact the institution to request a Kiva loan. 

He would like the loan to repair his vehicle, since it is the only means of work that he possesses.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Mchakato Group

texts.en:
Happy C. is in her late thirtes and is a widow with four children.  She has two business, selling charcoal and a beauty salon, which she has owned since 2007.  She works from 6.00am to 9.00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Happy's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the salon's equipment and start selling charcoal, household expenses and school fees. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase the salon equipments and to buy more sacks of charcoal.

Happy will share this loan with her loan group "Mchakato" which has a total of 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Happy is second from left 1st row.

loans.use: To increase salon equipment and buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos V. M. de 48 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su hija. Doña Santos ha trabajado toda su vida para sacar adelante a su familia y poder darles lo que necesitan. Ella posee un pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas el cual  es su mayor fuente de ingresos.  Ubicada en el Municipio de San Luis Talpa del Departamento de La Paz. Últimamente la demanda de sus ricas tortillas se ha visto incrementada  y cada día los clientes la prefieren más. Es por esta razón que ha decidido  solicitar este crédito para poder invertir en su negocio ya que por sus medios no le es posible. Necesita invertir en Maíz, agua, gas propano, y de más productos que sean necesarios para mantener su tortillería activa. De esta manera espera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia que día a día luchan por una realidad diferente.
texts.en:
Santos V. M., 48 years old, lives in her own home with her daughter.  Santos has worked all of her life to get her family ahead and to be able to give them what they need.  She has a small business selling tortillas, which is her main source of income.  It is located in the San Luis Talpa municipality of the La Paz department.

Lately, demand for her delicious tortillas has increased and each day clients prefer her more.  This is why she has decided to ask for this loan, to be able to invest in her business, as by her own means this is impossible.

Santos needs to invest in corn, water, propane gas, and more products that are necessary to maintain her tortillería.  She hopes to improve her family's quality of life, for day to day they fight for a different reality.

loans.use: invest in corn, water, propane gas and more products that may be necessary to maintain her tortillería.

loans.name: Mabomba Mengi Group

texts.en:
Maisha Y. is in her early thirties and married with three children who are still in school.  She has been selling cosmetics door to door for five years. She works 8.30am to 11.30am (three hours only) and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Maisha's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a fridge, sell juice, sarongs and cosmetics and paid back all of her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to increase on the cosmetics stock. Her dream is to one day open a cosmetics shop and a food shop.

Maisha will share this loan with her loan group Mabomba Mengi which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Maisha is the one sitting down infront in pink.

loans.use: To increase her cosmetics stock.

loans.name: Mawoulé Group

texts.fr:
MAWOULE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres font tous partie d'une même association de femmes. En vue d'accroître le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit. 
La représentante du groupe, Mouibatou Justine (qui a la main levée sur la photo), est mariée à un certain Pascal. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, tous scolarisés, dont deux représentent leurs propres enfants. Mouibatou Justine s'est installée avec sa famille à Atrokpocodji, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, depuis près de six ans.Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Mouibatou Justine vend depuis quinze ans déjà, des poteries et diverses plantes médicinales à son domicile. Mouibatou Justine s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et à Tori. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs obtenus. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Mouibatou Justine désire, ensemble avec ses autres membres, obtenir un autre financement.
texts.en:
Mawoulé is a group composed of three women. They are all members of the same women's association. In order to increase their activity level and better meet their customers' demand, the group members came to the microfinance institution Alidé and applied for a loan.

The group's representative, Mouibatou Justine (raising her hand on the photo) is married to Pascal. They provide for three children, all attending school. Two of them are their own children. Nearly six years ago, Mouibatou Justine settled with her family in Atrokpocodji in the municipality of Abomey Calavi. The parents provide together for their family. Mouibatou Justine has been selling from her home, for 15 years already, earthenware and medicinal herbs. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and in Tori. She is a long-standing client of Alidé and has repaid her previous loans on schedule. In order to strengthen her activity and meet her customers' demand, Mouibatou Justine and the other members of her group want to get a new loan.

loans.use: to buy a diversified set of earthenware and a sizeable quantity of medicinal herbs.

loans.name: Lilian Del Carmen

texts.es: Lilian del Carmen A. S. de treinta y seis años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en San Juan Opico en el departamento de la Libertad. Ella vende productos de cosmetología en su residencia y últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues siempre tiene lo que ellos necesitan, sus productos son de muy buena calidad y los vende a un buen precio; Lilian es muy amable siempre recibe a sus clientes con la mejor disposición. Quiere abastecer su negocio y le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos como tintes, shampo, acondicionadores, cremas, cosméticos entre otro, de esta manera ella podrá sacar adelante su negocio para Lilian la posibilidad de realizar su sueño de darle a su familia una vida plena ha hecho su vida más interesante pues le ha dado la oportunidad de superarse y además llevar seguridad económica a su hogar.
texts.en:
Lilian del Carmen A. S., age 36, lives with her husband and her two children in San Juan Opico, located in the department of La Libertad. She sells cosmetics from her home and recently has developed a very substantial client base because she always has what her clients need, because her products are of good quality, and also because she sells them at a good price. 

Lilian is a very kind person and always gives her clients great attention and positive attitude. She would like to purchase inventory for her business and is asking INTEGRAL for a loan that would allow her to buy products such as dyes, shampoo, conditioner, creams, cosmetics, and others. For Lilian, the possibility to realize her dream of giving a better life to her family has made her life more interesting because it gave her a challenge and the ability to bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, shampoo, conditioner, creams, and cosmetics

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: El señor Juan Manuel, tiene  43 años es casado y tiene dos hijos menores de edad. El se dedica a brindar el servicio de soldadura, todos sus trabajos los realiza en su negocio en donde llegan la mayoría de sus clientes a solicitar los servicios de Juan. Dio inicio a su negocio hace 11 años, con muy poco capital obtenido, ya que el siempre se ha encargado de mantener a su familia y lo ha logrado con este negocio. El crédito será invertido en la compra de herramientas, materiales, varillas, cableado entre otros productos. Su sueño es llegar a establecer un taller más grande, esto con el objetivo de obtener mejores ingresos que mejoren su calidad de vida y de su familia en general.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel is 43 years old, married, and has two dependent children.  He provides a welding service.  He does all his work in his business where most of his customers come to request his services.  He started his business 11 years ago with a small amount of capital.  He has always taken care of supporting his family and has managed this through his business.

Juan will invest his loan in setting up a bigger workshop which will allow him to make more income and thereby improve his family's general quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools, materials, bars, wiring and other products

loans.name: Yaguaron Poty Group

texts.es:
En la zona de Guayaibyty, en la ciudad de Paraguarí, se reunió un grupo de mujeres con el fin de informarse sobre el programa ofrecido por la Fundación Paraguaya, presentándoseles una oportunidad para tener un nivel de vida mejor decidieron realizar la reunión para la conformación del comité.
El comité lleva por nombre Yaguaron Poty por haberse creado en el Día de la Primavera, ellas se comprometieron a mantenerse unidas y trabajar bajo un marco de respeto mutuo entre todas; actualmente se encuentran en el sexto ciclo con calificación excelente, el grupo está integrado por 14  mujeres que en cada etapa anterior han invertido sus créditos en sus actividades diarias.
Hoy día, solicitan de nuevo otro préstamo para seguir aumentando sus negocios y por ende trabajando de manera mejor.
La sra. Maria Isabel se dedica a la cria y venta de gallinas, es un negocio que le ha dejado siempre muy buenos ingresos, pues como productos las gallinas son de muy buena calidad, y eso la ha ayudado a mantener la economía de su familia de manera estable.
Ella solicita el crédito especificamente para comprar medicamentos y comidas para aves de corral.
texts.en:
In Guayaibyty neighborhood, in the city of Paraguarí, a group of women came together in order to find out more information about the program offered by Fundación Paraguaya.  As they were presented with an opportunity to enjoy a better standard of living, they decided to call a meeting in order to form a committee.

The committee is called Yaguaron Poty because it was founded on Spring Day.  The women pledged to remain united and to work with mutual respect for each other.  They are currently in their sixth loan cycle and have an excellent record.  The group has 14 members (all women) who in each previous stage have invested their loans in their daily activities.  They are currently requesting a new loan to continue growing their businesses and, consequently, to continue working in a better manner.

Maria Isabel raises and sells hens.  This is a business which has always made her very good income as her hens are very good quality.  This has helped her to support her family's finances in a stable manner.  She is requesting this loan specifically to buy medicines and feed for her birds.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, medicines and feed for poultry

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Chiku I. is in her mid-thirties and married with two children who are still in school.  She has been selling fabrics, beetsheets, ladies clothes and sarongs, door to door since 2003.  She works from 8.00am to 2.00pm (six hours) and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Chiku's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her fabrics stock, buy a sewing machine, pay rent and school fees. She has paid back her loans sucessfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy fabrics from the Republic of Congo because they sell faster. Her dream is to one day own a clothing shop.

Chiku will share this loan with his loan group "Mshikamano" which has a total of 19 members.  The members of the group will hold each other in paying back their loans.

In the picture Chiku is in front 3rd from right in pink with a covered white and black scaf.

loans.use: To buy fabrics from the Republic of Congo.

loans.name: Sergio Bladimir

texts.es: Sergio Bladimir F. M. de veinticinco años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo en el departamento de San Salvador. El tiene un taller de pintura de automóviles en una zona muy concurrida, es muy conocido en el lugar pues tiene una excelente calidad de trabajo y tiene precios accesibles. Sergio es un hombre emprendedor  y siempre le recuerda a sus clientes que el mejor automovilista es aquel que posee la mejor pintura en su auto y los recibe con amabilidad y con una sonrisa en el rostro; quiere ofrecerle lo mejor a su clientela por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pintura de diferentes colores para estar preparado y no defraudar a las personas que lo visitan. Sergio tiene esperanza que su trabajo le ayudara a sacar adelante a su familia y lograra darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sergio Bladimir F. M. is 25 years old and lives with his life partner and son in San Salvador department.  He owns a car body paint shop in a very busy area.  He is very well known in his area as his work is very good quality and his prices are affordable.

Sergio is an enterprising man and he always reminds his customers that the best driver is the one with the best painted vehicle.  He greets his customers with kindness and a smile on his face.  Sergio would like to offer his customers the best and, for this reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow him to buy different colored paints so that he can be prepared and not let down the people who visit his business.  Sergio hopes that his work will help him to get his family ahead in life and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to paint cars

loans.name: Nazareth Group

texts.en:
Asia Y., is in her late thirties and married with four daughters. She has been running a food vendor business for one year. She works from 6.00am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Asia's 1st motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  She hopes for a loan to increase her food stock by buying sacks of rice, wheat flour, a backet of cooking oil and a sack of backing four. Her dream is to one day open a shop called tabletop, which will sell dry food, fruit and vegetables.

Asia will share this loan with her loan group "Nazareth", which has a total of 13 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their motisha loan. 

In the picture, Aisha is 1st on the right.

loans.use: to increase her food stock by buying sacks of rice, wheat flour, a backet of cooking oil and a sack of backing four.

loans.name: Sonia Ysabel

texts.es:
Sonia es una abogada y ofrece dentro de su oficina servicios jurídicos, es soltera pero tiene un hijo, vive en el barrio San Antonio de Pilar, posee casa propia y con ella vive su madre, Sonia es una persona muy activa y trabajadora con muy buenas referencias en su profesión.
Manifiesta que solicita el crédito para poder terminar la remodelación de su oficina, en la cual hizo ya anteriormente algunas modificaciones importantes.
Al mismo tiempo agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por los buenos servicios que le ha brindado al solicitar el préstamo y así también ella promete cumplir en tiempo y forma con el compromiso asumido con la empresa en caso de conseguir el crédito, para que así en un determinado tiempo pueda contar nuevamente con el apoyo de la Institución para cualquier emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Sonia is a lawyer and has an office where she offers legal services. She is single and has a son; she lives in the neighborhood of San Antonio de Pilar in her own house. Sonia's mother lives with her as well.

Sonia is a very active and hardworking person with a very good reputation in her profession. She is asking for a loan in order to finish the renovation of her office where she has already made some important changes. 

At the same time, Sonia would like to thank Fundación Paraguay for the great services that it has provided in the process of applying for the loan and would also like to say that she is very committed to repaying the loan in a timely manner because she hopes to be able to have the support of this institution for future projects.

loans.use: to renovate her office

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy flours, water, propane gas and trays.

loans.name: Santos Alexander

texts.es: Santos Alexander M. A., de 30 años de edad, habita en casa alquilada con su compañera de vida y su pequeña hijastra que por el momento  se encuentra estudiando. Posee un negocio en el que vende diversidad de productos como: cinchos, accesorios para celulares, brazaletes, relojes, corbos, cumas,  etc.  Ubicado en la calle principal del mercado Municipal de San Vicente del Departamento del mismo nombre.  Durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado para sacar adelante a su familia y sueña con ver a su hijastra convertida en una gran profesional. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos de Santos,  es por ello que lucha para mantenerlo activo y seguir recibiendo los ingresos que hasta el momento le ha brindado. Esto lo ha impulsado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el objetivo de invertir en su negocio y poder surtirlo con diversidad de artículos como: variedad de accesorios para celulares, cinchos, brazaletes, corbos, cumas,  etc.  Con la fe puesta en Dios que de esta manera lograra su sueño y podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Santos Alexander M. A., who is 30 years old, lives in a rented house with his life partner and their little girl who, for the moment, is studying. He owns a business in which he sells a variety of products such as belts, cell phone accessories, bracelets, watches, knives, etc. His business is located in the main street of the market Municipal de San Vicente in the department of the same name. For a long time he has worked to move forward for his family and he dreams of seeing his daughter become a great professional. This business is the only source of income for Santos, and because of that he is fighting to keep it active and continue receiving income, which up to this point he has been given. This has driven him to ask for this loan with INTEGRAL with the objective of investing in his business and to being able to supply it with a variety of products such as: a variety of cell phone accessories, belts, bracelets, knives, etc. He puts faith in God that in this way he will be able to accomplish his dream and improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of accessories for cell phones, belts, bracelets, knives, etc.

loans.name: Trifina

texts.es:
La señora Trifina de 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, su hijo ya es mayor de edad, ella cuenta con un Consultorio Odontológico, es mecánica dental y anexo vende materiales e insumos odontológicos, empezó hace más de 10 años ayudando a personas de escasos recursos, puesto que el costo de su servicio es bastante accesible.
Acudió a Fundación Paraguaya para acceder a una pequeña ayuda crediticia que destinaría a la compra de insumos odontológicos como ser: Dientes postizos, frenillos, anestesia y otros. La misma al retirarse agradeció la ayuda a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva porque gracias a la simple oportunidad de solicitar el crédito tiene la esperanza de que va a poder seguir brindando servicio de buena calidad a todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Trifina is 53 years old, and a single mother of a grown son. She works with Consultorio Odontológico as a dentist and in addition she sells materials and dentistry products. She began doing this more than 10 years ago helping people with limited resources since the cost of her service is very accessible. 
She turned to Fundación Paraguaya to obtain a little credit help that will allow her to buy dentistry products such as false teeth, braces, anesthesia and others. As she takes the aid, she thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva because thanks to the simple opportunity of requesting a loan she has the hope that she will be able to offer her good quality service to all her clients.

loans.use: to buy dentistry products such as false teeth, braces, anesthesia etc.

loans.name: Simba Group

texts.en:
Modesta W. is in her early thirties and married with three children who are still at school.  She has a second clothing and shoes business which she has been selling door to door for two years. She works from 8.00am to 4pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Modesta's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She hopes for a loan to buy  more second hand clothes and shoes.  Her dream is to one day build her own house.

Modesta will share this loan with her loan group "Simba" which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable is paying back their loans.

In the picture Modesta is in centre with a white blouse.

loans.use: To buy more second hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Rumichaca,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Julian; es conviviente, el socio tiene 48 años de edad; y tiene 4 hijos de 18, 8, 6, y 1 mes de edad; el socio es maestro de obras y se dedica a trabajar en diferentes constructoras, el socio también alterna sus actividades con la crianza de animales menores, el socio cría pollos, corderos, el socio desea el préstamo ahora para poder mejorar su casa el socio invertirá en la compra de materiales para resanar las paredes de su fachada y de su baño. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para resanar su vivienda.

El socio está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Manos Juntas Rumichaca-Alta” communal bank. This bank is located in the town of Rumichaca, in the province of Ururbamba, in the department of Cusco. 

The member is Julian. He lives with his partner, is 48 years old, and has 4 children who are 18, 8, and 6 years old, and one who is one month old. Julian is a master builder and he works for different construction companies. He also raises small animals, such as chickens and lambs. He needs the loan to make improvements to his house. He will buy materials to repair the walls of the front of the house and the bathroom. 

The member is very grateful for the loan and he promises to make his repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair his house

loans.name: María Inés

texts.es: María Inés M., habita en casa alquilada junto con su compañero de vida. Doña María es una mujer luchadora y por mucho tiempo ha trabajado para ganarse el pan de cada día. Ella posee una pequeña tienda en el que ofrece diversidad de dulces y galletas. Su negocio se encuentra  ubicado en el mercado Municipal de San Vicente del  Departamento del mismo nombre, zona muy transitada, en especial el negocio de Doña María ya que siempre atiende a sus clientes con una sonrisa y con mucha amabilidad.  Su sueño es contar con la capacidad económica que le permita invertir en su pequeño negocio con el fin de tener una mejor gama de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  ya que no puede realizar su sueño por sus propios medios. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de variedad de galletas: de  diferentes sabores, precio,  tamaño, etc.), Así como para la compra de variedad de dulces. De esta manera espera obtener un mejor nivel de ingresos que le ayuden a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mará Inés M. lives in a rented house with her partner. María is a hardworking woman and she has worked to earn a living for a long time. She has a small store where she sells a variety of sweets and cookies. Her business is located in the municipal market of San Vicente, in the department of the same name. The area sees a lot of traffic, especially María’s business because she always serves her customers with a smile and a lot of friendliness. Her dream is to have the economic capacity to invest in her small business so that she can have a greater variety of products to offer her customers, since they prefer more and more variety. For this reason she has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL, because she can’t achieve her dream otherwise. The loan will be used to buy a variety of sweets. In this way she hopes to achieve a higher level of income, which will help her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cookies in different flavors, prices, sizes, etc., and also sweets.

loans.name: Chicago Group

texts.en:
Frifence W., is in her mid-twenties and is single.  She has been selling ladies clothes door to door for two years. She works from 9.00am to 4.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Frifence's 3rd motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  She used the previous loans to go to Kariakoo shopping centre and buy more ladies clothes, handbags, and ladies shoes.  She has paid back her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more clothes, handbags and shoes. Her dream is to one day own a salon and put all the required equipments for that in her salon.

Frifence will share this loan with her loan group "Chicago" which has a total of 8 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Frifence is in front holding a handbag.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, handbags, and ladies shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as imitation leather, toe caps, and shoe forms

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge Alberto E. M. de 30 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su esposa y tres hijos. Jorge se dedica al transporte escolar y al transporte nocturno en la zona de Lourdes Colon del Departamento de La Libertad. Él posee dos microbuses que son sus principales herramientas para trabajar. Jorge es un hombre confíable, honesto y trabajador. Es muy reconocido en la zona y muchas personas lo prefieren por ser un hombre responsable, amable y muy dedicado en su trabajo. Ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en el mantenimiento de sus unidades de transporte ya que por el uso al que los somete, requieren de materiales que para Jorge es difícil comprarlas con medios propios. El Crédito lo solicita para la compra de llantas, pastillas para frenos, aceite, filtros, entre otros materiales necesarios para el buen funcionamiento de sus unidades de transporte. De esta manera podría seguir prestando su servicio de transporte que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en: Jorge Alberto E. M. is 30 and he lives in his own house with his wife and their three children.  Jorge drives a school bus and also drives a microbus at night in the Lourdes Colon area of the La Libertad department.  He has two microbuses that are what he uses for work.  Jorge is a trustworthy, honest and hard-working man who is known in the area and many people prefer a responsible, friendly man who is dedicated to his work.  He has decided to request a loan from Integral to be able to keep up the maintenace of these buses since with all the use they are subjected to,  the microbuses need parts that are hard for Jorge to buy with his own money.  He will use the loan to buy tires, break pads, oil, filters, etc which are some of the necessary items that are needed to keep the buses in good shape.  In this way he can continue with his transport business since that is the only income that he has to support his family.

loans.use: To buy tires, brake pads, oil, filters, and other necessary items to keep up the good functioniong of his microbuses

loans.name: Tufaidi Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is in her late thirties and married with four children who are still going to school. She has been running a pharmacy for three years and works from 8.00am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be Elizabeth's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the stock with whatever medicine was out.  She has paid back her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy more medicine.  Her dream is to one day own a small dispensary as she is a qualified nurse.

Elizabeth will share this loan with her loan group "Tufaidi" which has a total of 19 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable is paying back their loans.

In the picture, Elizabeth is wearing a light blue dress in the middle.

loans.use: To buy more medicine.

loans.name: Tai Group

texts.en:
Hawa Issa is in her early forties and is single with two children.  She has been operating a food vendor business for ten years. She works from 6.00am to 2.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Hawa's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to pay school fees, household expenses and increase on her food stock.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to increase her food stock.

Hawa will share this loan with her loan group "Tai" which has a total of 18 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans

In the picture, Hawa is on far left in front with a brown head cover.

loans.use: To increase her food stock in her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Hohenau - Encarnación y surgió por contacto de las señoras  con la fundación, es un grupo excelente y se encuentra en el 18º ciclo, pues opera con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2006.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Maria R., tiene 4 hijos, su marido es camionero y  ella tiene una despensa muy surtida en su barrio, en este negocio trabaja ella con la ayuda de todos sus hijos, gracias a esto también la despensa es muy conocida en la zona.
Cuenta la Sra. Maria que el crédito que solicita lo quiere utilizar para la compra de mercaderías a fin de surtir mejor la despensa, de esta manera puede mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
Todas las señoras del grupo también realizan actividades productivas y comerciales, por eso necesitan del apoyo de los inversionistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Hohenau-Encarnacion, and got together after making contact with one of the women from the Fundacion.  This is an excellent group that is in its 18th loan cycle and has worked with the Fundación Paraguaya since 2006.

One of the members of the group is Maria R..  She has 4 children and her husband is a truck driver.  She has a well-stocked neighborhood store where she works with all of her children.  Thanks to this her store is very well-known in the area.

Maria tells us that the loan that she requests will be used to purchase merchandise to better stock her store; in this way she can improve her family's income.

All of the members of the group also have productive and commercial activities, and for this reason they need the support of the Kiva investors.

loans.use: to buy groceries, bakery products, canned goods, drinks, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: José Amílcar

texts.es: José Amílcar P. reside en casa alquilada en el municipio de San Vicente del Departamento del mismo nombre. Durante mucho tiempo ha vivido solo y ha trabajado duramente para salir adelante. Don José posee un pequeño comedor en donde ofrece diversos platillos. El negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación y es asistido por una empleada;  a pesar que José es hombre de avanzada edad, está plenamente lleno de sueños y metas que dice él aún no culmina. Desea poder mejorar su calidad de vida y para ello  trabaja día con día con la esperanza y fe puesta en Dios que algún día lo logrará. Esto lo ha impulsado a solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en su pequeño negocio y poder ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de platillos para que cada día lo prefieran más. El crédito lo invertirá en insumos como: arroz, frijoles, verduras, carnes, café, frutas, etc. De esta manera espera obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: José Amílcar P. lives in a rented house in the municipality of San Vincente in the department of the same name.  He has lived alone for a long time, and he has worked hard to get ahead.  Jose has a small eatery where he offers a variety of dishes.  He has this business in his house, and he is assisted by an employee.  In spite of the fact that Jose is an older man, he is full of dreams and goals that he says he has yet to accomplish.  He wants to improve his quality of life, and to do this he works each day with the hope and faith in God that some day he will achieve this.  This has motivated him to apply for a loan from INTEGRAL so that he can invest in his small business and be able to offer his customers a greater variety of dishes, so that each day they will prefer his business more.  He will use this loan to buy supplies such as: rice, beans, vegetables, meats, coffee, fruit, etc.  In this way he hopes to have better earnings that will allow him to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, vegetables, meats, coffee, and fruit

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús Z. A. habita en casa propia con sus tres hijas dos de las cuales se encuentran cursando sus primeros años de estudio. Teresa se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora y sobre todo luchadora. Como cualquier madre responsable, ella sueña con ver a sus pequeñas hijas convertidas en profesionales y no pierde la esperanza de que algún día logrará su sueño. Ella se dedica a la venta de diversos productos como: lociones, cremas, jabones, productos comestibles  como galletas, etc.  No posee un puesto en donde ofrecer sus productos por lo que los comercializa de manera ambúlante en el Municipio de San Vicente del Departamento de San Vicente, durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado de esta forma y es  así como se gana el pan de cada día. Sus productos los vende con facilidad gracias a su carisma y compromiso en su trabajo. Ha tomado la decisión de aumentar  la variedad de productos que ofrece con el fin de atraer a más clientes y así poder seguir dando a sus hijas lo necesario. Para poder cumplir su sueño necesita de este crédito que solicita a INTEGRAL  para poder comprar variedad de cremas para el cuerpo, cremas para el cabello,  lociones (para hombre y mujer), jabones, maquillaje, y de más artículos que sean atractivos para los clientes. De esta manera  aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús Z. A. lives in her own home with her three daughters who are in their first few years of attending school. She is known for being an enterprising and extremely determined woman. Like any responsible mother, Teresa dreams of seeing her young daughters become professionals. She does not lose hope of someday seeing her dream come true.

Teresa sells different products such as lotions, crèmes, soaps, snacks such as cookies, and other items. She does not have a vending post where she offers her products, so she sells her merchandise as a traveling vendor in the town of San Vincente in the Department of San Vicente. Teresa has spent great amount of time working in this manner so that she can earn a living. Her products sell easily due to her charisma and her commitment to her work. She decided to expand the variety of products that she offers so that she can attract more customers and continue providing her daughters with what they need.

To fulfill her dream, Teresa decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy a variety of body crèmes, hair gels, lotions for men and women, soaps, makeup, and other products that are popular with her customers. By working in this manner, she hopes to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase body crèmes, hair gels, lotions for men and women, soaps, makeup, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy palm-oil, groundnuts, etc. in bulk to add to his business.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Rumichaca,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Ramon; es conviviente, el socio tiene 45 años de edad; y tiene 1 hijo de 17 años de edad; el socio es albañil y trabaja en diferentes obras, el socio siempre esta tras de los trabajos y las constructoras ofreciendo su trabajo, además que es muy trabajador y siempre tiene trabajitos en el año así que él desea en esta oportunidad comprar una maquina mezcladora, esta máquina le permitirá mezclar el cemento con arena y agua, para sacar una masa compacta, el socio requiere el crédito para este fin. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una maquina mezcladora.

El socio está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sr. Ramon is a member of the Communal Bank “Manos Juntas Rumichaca-Alta” which is located in the village of Rumichaca in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

He is 45 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a 17-year-old son. Ramon is a mason and works on different construction jobs. He is always behind in his work, but builders keep offering him jobs. In addition to working hard in his masonry, Ramon also performs odd jobs throughout the year. For this reason, he is taking the opportunity to purchase a cement mixer that will help him combine cement, sand, and water into a compact substance. Ramon is requesting a loan so that he can invest the funds in the purchase of a cement mixer.

He is extremely grateful for the loan and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase a cement mixer.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora S. de 57 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su  esposo en el Municipio de Cuscatancingo  del  Departamento de San Salvador. Doña Flora ha trabajado toda su vida para lograr tener un poco mas de ingresos que ayuden a solventar los problemas económicos de su hogar. Ella posee una tienda y tortillería en su casa de habitación que con mucho amor atiende día con día. Por el momento es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuentan  ya que su esposo es pensionando pero ha tenido algunas dificultades y no la está recibiendo.  A pesar de su avanzada edad Doña Flora sigue luchando para seguir adelante, su sueño es tener una mejor gama de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes con el objetivo de aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su calidad de vida. Solicita este crédito para poder realizar su sueño y poder comprar variedad de artículos como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, café, azúcar, gaseosas, galletas, y maíz para su tortillería, de esta forma  poder dar a sus clientes variedad y calidad de productos. Como toda mujer emprendedora espera obtener buenos resultados de sus sacrificios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su esposo.
texts.en: Flora S. is 57 years old and lives in her own home with her husband in the town of Cuscatancingo in the Department of San Salvador.  Doña Flora has worked all of her life in order to earn a little more income to help resolve the financial problems of her household.  She has a store and a tortilla shop in her home that she manages with love day after day.  At the moment, these businesses are the only source of income she has since her husband is a pensioner and has experienced problems receiving his benefits.  Despite her age, Doña Flora continues to press forward in order to get ahead.  Her dream is to have a wider range of products to offer her customers so that she can increase her sales and improve her quality of life.  She is requesting a loan so that she can fulfill her dream and acquire merchandise such as rice, beans, oil, coffee, sugar, sodas, cookies, and corn for her tortilla shop so that she can give her customers a variety of high-quality products.  As an enterprising woman, Flora hopes to obtain good results as a result of her sacrifices in order to improve the quality of life for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, coffee, sugar, sodas, cookies, and corn.

loans.name: Juana Maribel

texts.es: Juana Maribel A. de 43 años de edad vive  en su casa con su esposo, cuatro hijos y una nieta. Doña Juana se dedica a la venta de pan dulce en diferentes zonas de San Salvador. Ella reside en el Municipio de Cojutepeque pero todos los días se traslada en un Pick up  a las zonas de San Martin, Soyapango y San Bartolo que son Municipios de la capital del país: San Salvador. Para ofrecer el rico pan que con tanto amor prepara.  Es muy conocida y muchas personas la prefieren por ser una persona amable y muy  entregada en su negocio, además para ella lo más importante es que sus clientes encuentren un producto de buena calidad y al mejor precio. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y poder ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de pan. Esto la ha impulsado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con la esperanza que de esta manera su situación económica mejorará. Desea invertir en la materia prima para la producción del pan como: harina, azúcar, huevos, canela, agua, y demás insumos que le sean útiles para mejorar la variedad de pan que ofrece.
texts.en:
Juana Maribel A. is 43 years old and lives at home with her husband, four children, and a granddaughter. Doña Juana sells sweet breads in different areas of San Salvador. She resides in the town of Cujutepeque, but every day she travels in her pickup truck to different areas of the capital city of San Salvador, such as San Martin, Soyapango, and San Bartolo. Juana is well-known and many people prefer to do business with her because she is a kind person who is dedicated to her work. For her the most important thing is that her customers receive a good quality product at the best price. She dreams of expanding her business so that she can offer her customers a wider variety of bread. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in hopes to improving her financial situation.

Juana wants to invest in supplies used in her production such as flour, sugar, eggs, cinnamon, water, and other items that will improve the variety of breads that she offers.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, eggs, cinnamon, water, and other supplies.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS RUMICHACA - ALTA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Rumichaca,  provincia de Urubamba y  departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Nicanor; es soltero, el socio tiene 19 años de edad; y es considerado como el socio más joven del grupo, el socio es un chico muy hábil y lleno de deseos de triunfar en la vida, el socio se dedica a criar animales menores como son cuyes, el socio cuenta con un galpón de cuyes  y desea comprar 20 cuyes más para incrementar su galpón y gradualmente ir aumentando más y mientras van reproduciéndose los cuyes el socio venderá al por mayor a los diferentes restaurantes de la zona, esta zona es muy bonita con un clima privilegiado y atrae a propios y turistas a pasar días aquí visitando el pueblo de Urubamba que es considerado cuna del valle sagrado de los inkas. El socio desea reunir su dinero y seguir creciendo en los negocios y también poder estudiar en la universidad, el es un joven con muchas aspiraciones. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cuyes.

El socio está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sr. Nicanor is a member of the Communal Bank “Manos Juntas Rumichaca-Alta” which is located in the village of Rumichaca in Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

He is 19 years old, single, and the youngest member of his group. Nicanor is a skillful young man who is filled with the desire to succeed in life. He raises domesticated animals such as guinea pigs. Nicanor has a guinea pig pen and wants to buy 20 more so that he can increase his inventory and allow them to reproduce. He sells the animals in bulk to different restaurants in the area. The beautiful town of Urubamba, which is considered to be the cradle of the Sacred Valley of the Incas, experiences a pleasant climate that attracts locals and tourists alike. Nicanor is in need of funds to continue growing his business and complete his studies at the university. He is a young man with many aspirations, so he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of guinea pigs.

Nicanor is extremely grateful for the loan and promises to complete his payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mujeres Al Poder Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres al Poder”, está en el cuarto ciclo con 17 integrantes, es un grupo de señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras.
Son humildes pero sacrificadas, no tienen en cuenta las dificultades que se les presenta cada día porque ellas buscan la superación laboral, por ellas mismas y sus familias, ellas dicen que la familia lo es todo, por eso se esmeran por salir adelante y con orgullo de ser honradas.
La sra. Graciela es la presidenta del comité y ella se dedica a la venta de comidas en un puesto que posee, desde allí trata de proveer de los mejores comestibles a las distintas personas que acuden a su negocio, es muy servicial y se preocupa mucho por la calidad de lo que ofrece.
Ella trata de ser amiga de sus clientes y no sólo comerciante, pues dice que todos podemos ser amigos, más allá del mero hecho de comprar y vender como desconocidos.
Esperando contar con la ayuda de Kiva, solicitan el crédito para comprar todos los materiales para incrementar sus micro-empresas, y la sra. Graciela lo solicita para adquirir panificados, carnes, legumbres, bebidas y otros comestibles necesarios para la preparacion de alimentos y posterior venta.
texts.en:
This committee is named “Mujeres al Poder” (Women of Power), which is starting its fourth loan cycle with 17 members. All of these women are responsible and hardworking. The members are humble, but have made sacrifices. They do not take into account the difficulties presented before them each day because they seek to excel in their work for themselves and their families. For them, family is everything so they seek to move forward with pride and honesty.

Sra. Graciela is the committee president. She sells food from a stand that she owns. There she tries to provide the best food products to the various people who come to her business. Graciela is very helpful and concerned about the quality of products that she offers. In addition, she tries to be a friend to her customers, not just a merchant. She says that everyone can become friends instead of buying and selling as strangers.

Hoping to receive assistance from Kiva, the members are requesting a loan to buy all of the supplies needed to expand their small businesses. Sra. Graciela will use the loan she requested to buy baked goods, meats, legumes, beverages, and other food products needed for preparing dishes to sell later.

loans.use: to purchase baked goods, meats, legumes, beverages, and other food products.

loans.name: Esperanza Idalia

texts.es: Esperanza Idalia P. D. S. D. 43 años D. edad habita en casa propia con sus tres hijas que se encuentran estudiando y su esposo que es agricultor. Doña Esperanza es una mujer emprendedora que ha hecho D.  su casa un negocio. Ella posee un pequeño comedor en su casa D. habitación, ubicado en el Municipio D. Ciudad Arce del Departamento D. La Libertad. Es muy conocida en la zona  y goza D. muy buenas referencias gracias a los deliciosos platillos que prepara.  Los cliente solicitan mucho su comida y muchas veces ella desea poder contar con los recursos necesarios para poder ofrecer más variedad D. platillos a sus clientes. Esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en los insumos necesarios como: Verduras, frutas, carnes, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, etc. Con la esperanza D. poder aumentar sus ventas y logras mejores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Esperanza Idalia P. D. S., age 43, resides in her own home with her three school-age daughters and her husband who is a farmer. Doña Esperanza is an enterprising woman who has established a home business. She manages a small diner at her house located in the town of Ciudad Arce in the Department of La Libertad. Esperanza is well-known in the area and enjoys excellent references because of the delicious food that she prepares. Her customers request her food and there have been many times when she wanted to have the necessary resources to offer them a wider variety of dishes.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral to invest in the following supplies: vegetables, fruits, meats, rice, beans, sugar, corn, and other items. Esperanza hopes to increase her sales and earn better income so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, meats, rice, beans, sugar, corn, and other items.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo O. C. habita en casa pastoral de la Iglesia con su esposa y tres hijos. Ubicado en el Municipio de San Juan Opico del Departamento de La Libertad.  Vive en condiciones muy humildes y cada día lucha por mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Arturo se dedica  a la venta de vitaminas en diferentes zonas del municipio de Opico del Departamento de La Libertad. Tiene buena clientela y sus productos los vende con facilidad. Su deseo es ampliar la oferta de productos para sus clientes, pero no cuenta con los recursos económicos para hacerlo es por ello que solicita a INTEGRAL este crédito para poder comprar variedad de productos como: variedad de vitaminas, pastillas para los paracitos, pomadas para la piel, pomadas para los hongos y de mas medicamentos de salud que son atractivos para los clientes.  Con esto espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia que cada día le exigen más.
texts.en:
Arturo O. C. lives at a church parsonage with his wife and three children in the town of San Juan Opico in the Department of La Libertad. His home has very modest conditions and he struggles each day to improve the quality of life of his family.

Arturo sells vitamins in different areas of the town of Opico in the Department of Libertad. He has a good customer base and his products sell easily. His wish is to expand the array of products that he offers to his customers, but he does not have the financial resources to make this happen. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that he can buy a variety of products such as an assortment of vitamins, pills for combating parasites, skin creams, antifungal ointments, and other medicines that are popular with his customers. By acquiring these products, Arturo hopes to improve his quality of life and that of his family so that they can continue to survive on a daily basis.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of vitamins, pills for combating parasites, skin creams, antifungal ointments, and other medicines.

location.town: Opico en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Irma Graciela

texts.es: Irma Graciela C. R. vive con sus dos hijos en la zona de San Emigdio en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Ella tiene un negocio en su misma casa, vende pupusas por las noches y en el día se dedica a vender productos para el cuidado personal de la piel, rostro y manos, sus clientes la prefieren por la calidad y el rico sabor de sus pupusas; también tiene mucha clientela que le compra los otros productos que ofrece pues se los da a un buen precio, además ella se caracteriza por ser muy servicial siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa en el rostro, sus ganas de salir adelante la motivaron a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar material para las pupusas como queso, frijoles, harina, y productos para el cuidado personal como cremas, perfumes entre otros. Irma es muy entregada a su trabajo pues con el lleva el sustento a su hogar, y tiene fe que con su labor en un futuro le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Irma Graciela C. R. lives with her two children in the San Emigdio area in the Cuscatlán department.  She has a business in her home.  She sells pupusas [stuffed tortillas] at night, and during the day sells personal care products for the skin, face, and hands.  Her customers prefer the quality and rich taste of her pupusas.  She also has many customers who purchase the other products she offers.  She offers good prices, and she is known to be very helpful and always greets her customers with a smile on her face.  

Her desire to succeed motivated her to ask for a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow her to purchase ingredients to make pupusas like cheese, beans, and flour, as well as personal care products like creams and perfumes.  Irma is very dedicated to her work because it supports her family, and she has faith that her hard work will give her family a better quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, beans, flour, creams, and perfumes.

loans.name: María Estefa

texts.es:
María tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera y reside junto a su pequeña hija en el caserío de  Barrio Libre que se ubica en el distrito de Las Lomas, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la Región de Piura, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en general. Ella ofrece estos productos tanto al crédito como al contado y los ofrece principalmente entre sus vecinos y conocidos, recorriendo también los diferentes caseríos de la zona donde vive. Esta actividad es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y se vale de ella para ayudar al mantenimiento de su economía diaria.

María desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio ya que desea incrementar sus ventas en la temporada de verano- otoño ya que durante esta temporada la demanda por su negocio aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

María es una joven bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, las personas que le conocen admiran sus ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
texts.en:
María is 26 years old and a single mother who lives with her young daughter in the village of Barrio Libre, which is located in the District of Las Lomas. This farming area experiences significant business activity and is located in Piura region, which is more than three and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

María sells clothes. She offers her products on credit and for cash and sells them primarily to her neighbors and acquaintances. María also travels to different villages in the same district where she lives. This business has been a great help to her family’s finances and has enabled her to maintain her daily way of life.

María wants to acquire more merchandise so that she can expand her business. She wants to increase her sales during the summer and autumn seasons since there is more demand on these occasions. For this reason, she is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa a loan in the amount of 500 PEN to help her accomplish this goal.

María is a hardworking and earnest young woman. The people who know her admire her drive to succeed and make progress.

loans.use: to acquire more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Teresa Aydee

texts.es:
Teresa comenzó con su negocio de confección hace 8 años; este oficio lo aprendió de su hermana quien le enseño ha hacer todo tipo de bordados. Poco a poco fue perfeccionando su técnica con tan buenos resultados que hoy en día alterna su trabajo de confección con las clases que dicta a otras personas que están interesadas en aprender sobre este mismo oficio.
 
Teresa actualmente debe responder por muchos proyectos que sus clientes le han encargado pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar los insumos y así cumplir con los pedidos. Ella es una mujer soñadora y emprendedora que trabaja todos los días de 7:00a.m a 8p.m. siempre luchando por fidelizar a sus clientes y hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa started her embroidery business 8 years ago. She learned this trade from her sister who taught her to do all types of embroidery.  She gradually improved her technique, yielding very good results, so much so that today she alternates her sewing business with classes that she gives to others that are interested in learning this trade. 

Teresa has a number of outstanding orders that her clients have placed but she doesn't have the capital funds that she needs to purchase the materials to fill theses orders. She is a dreamer and she is an enterprising woman who works every day from 7am to 8pm, always endeavoring to gain loyal clients and to make her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Kayainktheke Group

texts.en: Issa Banard T. (pictured in the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 40 years ago in Magburaka town, Issa is married and has 4 children.  For over 6 years now, Issa has been running a pharmacy. He is going to use his share of the loan (SLL 1,000,000) to expand his business by buying a wide variety of medicine to add into his pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy a wide variety of medicine to add to his pharmacy.

loans.name: Diva Ester

texts.es:
Diva Esther P. tiene 67 años y vive en el barrio "Los Caracoles" de la ciudad de Cartagena, donde se dedica a la venta de mercancías variada, como cosméticos, electrodomésticos de marcas reconocidas y ropa en general, actividad con la que ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante gracias a su trabajo, pues es una mujer viuda y madre de 4 hijos, hoy en las edades de 30 a 45 años. Inicialmente trabajó de empleada de una familia y luego lo hizo  independientemente vendiendo productos puerta a puerta, impulsada por una amiga, de esta manera construyó su propia clientela y hoy la buscan en su casa para comprarle productos, pues ofrece crédito y contado a buenos precios.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él comprará mercancías variadas, como cosméticos, ropa para damas, aprovechando la temporada de incremento de sus ventas con motivo de la celebración del día de las madres, fecha en la cual sus clientes quieren homenajear a todas las mujeres de las familias que son madres, mediante el obsequio de detalles que solo Diva sabe escoger  y venderles. Su sueño es tener un capital suficiente para rotarlo rápidamente y ganar más dinero con el incremento de sus ventas, pero mientras esto ocurre, ella se esmera en sostener su negocio con una autonomia del 73,25%, una rentabilidad no menor de 35% y responderle a su clientela con responsabilidad y calidad en la venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Diva Esther P. is 67 years old and she lives in the community of "Los Caracoles" in the city of Cartagena where she has a general store, selling cosmetics, household items of well-known brands and clothing in general. It is through this business that she has been able to support her family. She is a widow and the mother of 4 children, aged between 30 to 45 years of age. She started out working as an employee of a family and later she became independent, selling products from door to door. She was encouraged by a friend and this is how she earned her own client base and today they look to buy her products at her house. She completes her sales on credit and in cash, giving good prices.

This is her first loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and with it she will purchase various merchandise, including cosmetics and ladies' clothing taking advantage of the season when the sales are high for the Mother's Day celebrations. For this day her clients wish to honor all of the women of their families who are mothers with a kind of gift that ony Diva knows how to chose and offer for sale. Her dream is to have enough capital funds to reinvest rapidly and to generate more income with the increase her sales.  But in the meantime she endeavors to maintain her business independently at 73.25% and a profit margin of no less than 35%. She also works to respond to her clients with responsibility and with quality products.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise such as cosmetics and ladies' clothing.

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe MAHUGNON est composé de trois personnes qui vivent tous dans le même quartier à Sèdégbé, dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. 
La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marguerite est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Marguerite est née en 1958 à Tokpa-Domè au Bénin. Marguerite est une veuve ayant à sa charge trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Depuis une trentaine d’année, Marguerite s’est installée à Sèdégbé, où elle vit avec ses enfants. Marguerite  assure seule les charges de la famille, grâce aux revenus que lui procure son activité. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Marguerite exerce depuis une vingtaine d’année, comme activité la vente de pain et d’autres produits divers (conserves de sardine et de tomate, sucre, lait, savons, pâtes alimentaires, etc.). Marguerite achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et le pain dans les boulangeries de Cotonou. C’est cependant à son domicile que Marguerite revend ses produits. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Marguerite sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Mahugnon Group is composed of three women who live in the same neighborhood of Sèdégbé in the municipality of Abomey Calavi. This is the third time that they apply for financial assistance from the microfinance institution Alidé in order to boost their activity level.

The group's representative is Marguerite, who is pictured raising her hand. She was born in Tokpa-Domè in Benin in 1958. She is widowed and provides for three children, who all attend school. Some 30 years ago, Marguerite settled in Sèdégbé, where she currently lives with her children. She provides alone for the household, thanks to the income from her business activity. For the past two decades Marguerite has been selling bread and other goods (canned sardines and tomatoes, sugar, milk, soap, pasta, etc.). Marguerite buys her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and her bread from bakers in Cotonou. It is from her home that she sells her goods. Eager to satisfy her customers' needs and increase her income, Marguerite and her group apply for another loan.

loans.use: to buy bread, canned sardines, milk, pasta and two cans of peanut oil.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina R. D. E. D. cuarenta y nueve años D. edad vive en casa propia con su compañero D. vida y sus dos hijos en Opico en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella posee un puesto en el mercado regional del lugar, donD. se dedica a vender frutas y verduras. Marina se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues su entusiasmo en la venta y su carisma hacia las personas ha provocado la preferencia D. los clientes. Para Marina dar su cortesía no cuesta nada y con ello gana mucho. Ella quiere abastecer su puesto y eso la impulso a solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más fruta y verdura como jocotes, tomates, aguacates, cebollas, entre otros; para así satisfacer la necesidad D. todos sus clientes y al mismo tiempo incrementar su fuente D. ingresos, colaborando a su esposo en llevar el sustento D. cada día al hogar y dando a su familia una vida más digna.
texts.en: Marina R. D. E. is forty-nine years old and she lives in a house that she owns. She lives with her life partner and their two children in Opico in the department of La Libertad. She has a stand in the regional market in the area where she sells fruits and vegetables. Marina has earned a clientele with her great enthusiasm in carrying out her sales and her charisma towards her customers and this has provoked a preference in her clients. Marina doesn't feel like giving her courtesy costs her anything and with it she gains much. She wants to add inventory to her stand and this prompted her to approach Integral (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan which will permit her to purchase more fruit and vegetables, such as red mombin, tomatoes, avocadoes, onions, and other produce. All of this to satisfy the need of all of her clients and at the same time increase her source of income. She collaborates with her husband by earning an inconme for the household and  by providing her family with a more dignified life.

loans.use: to purchase red mombin, tomatoes, avocaodes, and onions.

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es una joven de la ciudad de Medellín que decidió crear un nuevo negocio de alimentos. Desde muy pequeña le ayudaba a su madre con el cuidado de sus hermanos haciéndoles la comida y poco a poco fue aprendiendo a cocinar exquisitos platos. Consciente de su destreza decidió comenzar con la venta de los alimentos que prepara, los cuales han tenido gran acogida entre sus clientes. Ella es madre soltera y trabaja de domingo a domingo para velar por el bienestar de su hijo.
 
Alejandra  reconoce que los mejores días de trabajo son los del  los fines de semana e incluso ya ha tenido contratos para cocinar en fiestas y eventos pero como debe estar comprando constantemente los ingredientes para hacer la comida y los platos desechables para distribuirla, ella requiere del capital necesario para surtir su negocio, sin embargo como apenas está comenzando ha solicitado un crédito para adquirir los insumos que perduren por lo menos 1 mes y medio, mientras se estabiliza económicamente.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a young woman from the city of Medellín who decided to create a new food business. From the time she was very young she helped her mother with the care of her siblings, making them food and little by little she learned to cook wonderful food. Aware of her skill, she decided to sell the foods that she prepares and they have had great success among her customers. She is a single mother and she works from Sunday to Sunday in order to provide for her son.

Alejandra knows that the best work days are weekends and she has also had contracts to cook for parties and events. Since she must constantly buy ingredients for making her food, and the disposable plates to distribute it, she needs capital to stock her business. Since she is just getting started, she has requested a loan to buy enough ingredients to last for at least a month and a half, while she stabilizes herself economically.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and disposable plates for the foods she cooks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Santos Margarita

texts.es: Doña Santos Margarita T.,tiene 53 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales ninguno estudia, se dedica al comercio, a la reventa de cortes típicos de seda, lleva 2 años de experiencia en este negocio, inició por iniciativa propia y deseos de superación, se acerca a ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para capital de trabajo, para la compra de cortes típicos para su reventa, y obtener la ganancia, espera con la inversión que hace  tenga un negocio mas grande y mejores ganancias, y darle de esta manera un mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Mrs. Santos Margarita T., 53 years old, has 3 children none of whom are in school. She is a merchant, re-selling traditional cuts of silk. She has been doing this for two years. She got started on her own initiative and her desire to get ahead. She came to ASDIR to ask for a loan for business capital, to purchase traditional fabric cuts for resale and to earn money this way. She hopes that by making this investment she will have a larger business and better profits and so will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cuts of silk for resale

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia A. D. C. D. 57 años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en el departamento D. Santa Ana. Ella posee una tienda en su residencia la cual es muy visitada por las personas del lugar porque en toda ocasión encuentran lo que necesitan. Cada día aumenta más su clientela y no los quiere decepcionar y se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le dé la oportunidad D. comprar más productos para su negocio como bebidas, golosinas, sopas instantáneas, granos  básicos entre otros. Ana es una mujer que cumple sus metas, siempre se repite: "lo que me propongo, con la ayuda D. Dios, lo cumplo" Ella ha depositado toda su confianza en que através D. este crédito, logrará otro propósito, el D. dar a su familia la vida plena que se merecen.
texts.en: Ana Julia A. D. C., 57 years old, lives with her life partner and their children in the department of Santa Ana. She has a store in her home that is much-frequented by the people in her neighborhood because they always find what they need for any occasion. Every day her clientele increases and she doesn't want to disappoint them. She decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will give her the opportunity to buy more products for her store like drinks, snacks, instant soups and basic grains, among other things. Ana is a woman who meets her goals, and she always tells herself "what I propose to myself, with the help of God, I accomplish". She has placed total confidence in the fact that through this loan she will achieve another goal, that of giving her family the full life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snacks, instant soups and basic grains

loans.name: María Jesus

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos en el caserío Quemazón  del distrito de Mórrope. Un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

María se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años por esos conoce a la perfeccione este rubro. Ella cría animales menores, especialmente ganado vacuno y aves de corral, en  un ambiente  en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

María desea adquirir alimento balanceado para sus animales y así ampliar su negocio permitiéndole percibir mayores ingresos, también desea comprar unas planchas de eternit para realizar algunas mejoras en su casa. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Maria is a 38-year-old mother who lives, together with her husband and their 4 children, in the village of Quemazón in the district of Mórrope. It is an agricultural district that is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Maria raises and sells animals, an activity that she has been doing for 15 years. For that reason, she knows this line of work very well. She raises young animals, especially beef cattle and chickens, in an environment in the back part of her home. She feeds them grains and natural grasses, and when they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the business men that frequently visit the area where she lives.

Maria wants to get balanced feed for her animals and thereby increase her business, allowing her to get greater income. She also wants to buy some corrugated roofing to make some improvements to her home. For this reason, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles which will help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy breads, sauces, meats and repair his cart

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es:
Marta  se dedica al  comercio en la venta de ropa usada, y una pequeña pulpería, que inicio, con ahorros propios, y que ha venido a reforzar con préstamos que Afodenic ha otorgado en tres ciclos. 
La mercadería la  compra en el mercado oriental a los proveedores,  para lograr precios favorables y así poder vender a mejor precios a sus clientes. Siempre con el anhelo de poder apoyar  a sus tres hijos, que junto con su esposo trabajan para el bienestar de su futuro.
Marta comprara con este nuevo préstamo  dos pacas mixtas de ropa usada, para seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Marta sells used clothing and has a small grocery store that she started with her own savings and has reinforced with loans from Afodenic during three lending cycles. She buys her merchandise in the bazaar from the wholesalers, to get more favorable prices and therefore be able to sell to her customers at better prices. 

She has always wanted to be able to support her three children, who together with her husband work for the well-being of their future.

Marta will use this new loan to buy two mixed bundles of used clothing to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to buy two mixed bundles of used clothing to sell more in the summer

loans.name: María Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “María Auxiliadora”, está constituido  por 15  señoras muy activas y solidarias que constantemente se hallan realizando actividades para la comunidad y para recaudar fondos para el grupo.
Ellas tienen actividades diferentes y algunas emprenderán una nueva labor, están en el Décimo Segundo Ciclo.
Estas mujeres son muy preparadas para las microempresas a las que se dedican, cada una conoce exactamente sus rubros, incluyendo sus riesgos y ventajas, por eso solicitan el crédito para poder incrementar sus inversiones y ganancias.
La sra. Mirian posee una cantina, desde donde provee con los mejores productos comestibles a todos los individuos que acuden a su negocio, en especial a aquellos trabajadores que no pueden ir a sus casas para la hora de la comida, del almuerzo.
Ella gana buenas referencias gracias a sus buenos servicios, por ende logra tener mayores ingresos eocnómicos para mantener y sustentar de manera estable a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar panificados, carnes, embutidos, verduras, frutas, etc.
texts.en:
The committee calls itself "Maria Auxiliadora" and is made up of 15 very active and unified women who always find themselves doing activities for the community and raising funds for the group. They have different businesses and some will start a new line of work. They are in their 12th cycle.

These women are very prepared for their small businesses, each one knows her line of work well, including the risks and benefits. For this reason they asked for a loan to be able to increase their investments and earnings.

Mirian owns a cantina where she sells the best food products to everyone who comes to her store, especially the workers who can't go home on their lunch hour. She gets good references thanks to her good service, and consequently she has achieved better income for maintaining and sustaining her family in stable way. 

She asks for this loan to be able to buy baked goods, meats, sausages, vegetables, fruits, etc.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, meats, sausages, vegetables, fruits, etc

loans.name: Maria Esperanza
